lg.l: I Rashly pend, doo spring from barren braine,
A simple mēe, in prose for to declare:
vvhat sorovves sovver, vvhat greefs & pīching pain
This life dooth bring, vvherby vve may prepare,
VVith death to Christe avvay frō hence to fare,
VVherfore in gree accept vvhat heer is said:
Since meer goodvvil vvas cause that he it made
I shovve in breef hovv Vertue vvinneth Fame
Hovv she alone brings true Felicitie:
Hovv all that is on earth is nought but vain,
And hovv vve ought esteem Gentillitie.
Misconster nothing that thou spiest in me,
So by that meanes thou vvin'st his hart and all:
In promptest vvise to pleasure thee at call.
Blame not his skil,
for of good vvil •
From him I came:
as only mean,
To purge him clean
of thankles name.
As dooth behooue,
let him thy looue,
And good vvoord gain▪
abandon Spite,
So maiest thou quite
his little pain.
